intro: Canscora sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flowered ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils. Canscora sessiliflora is adapted to drought conditions and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
